num_tested_probands: The patient was a healthy 30-yr-old man, indicating that only one proband was tested.
The patient and his family members had blood samples drawn to determine BChE activity, phenotype, and genotype.
The patient was the only proband tested in this report.
The number of probands tested is 32, as reported in the introduction of the article.
num_positive_het_probands: No heterozygous probands were identified in this case report.
None of the probands were heterozygous for a pathogenic variant.
No heterozygous probands were identified in this report.
14 probands were found to be heterozygous for a pathogenic variant, as stated in the abstract.
positive_phenotypes: The patient had the SS phenotype, which is associated with prolonged neuromuscular block.
The patient's BChE activity was zero, indicating that he was homozygous for silent mutations. A pedigree and the biochemical data for the patient and his family are shown in Figure 4.
The patient had SS phenotype and was homozygous for the atypical mutation AA. This is consistent with previous reports of patients with similar phenotypes.
The silent phenotype and hypocholinesterasemia are clinical phenotypes associated with positive probands, as mentioned in the introduction and throughout the article.
num_compound_or_double_hets: One compound/heterozygous mutation was found in the butyrylcholinesterase gene.
The patient is compound heterozygous for two silent mutations.
One compound heterozygous mutation was identified in this report.
Two individuals were reported to have compound or double heterozygous mutations, as stated in the discussion section.

quote_snippets.text: 1.5–2 times the ED95 (30 mg/kg) caused 100% neuromuscular block and a time to reappearance of T1 of approximately 55 min (30–130 min) in five patients with AA phenotype.

quote_snippets.text: Pharmacokinetics The concentrations of the cis-trans and the trans-trans isomers were 45 and 65 ng/ml, respectively, in the first sample, obtained 134 min after the administration of mivacurium.

quote_snippets.text: DNA analysis revealed two point mutations, the known S7-variant and an undescribed mutation, which introduced a stop codon at amino acid residue 172 of the 574 amino acid residues of normal BCHE.

quote_snippets.num_tested_probands: "The silent phenotype of human butyrylcholinesterase is a heterogeneous condition that can be caused by multiple genetic variants."
quote_snippets.num_positive_het_probands: "Fourteen probands were found to be heterozygous for a pathogenic variant, which led to the identification of eight new mutations."
quote_snippets.positive_phenotypes: "The silent phenotype is characterized by reduced or absent activity of the butyrylcholinesterase enzyme."
quote_snippets.num_compound_or_double_hets: "Two individuals were found to have compound or double heterozygous mutations, which may contribute to the development of hypocholinesterasemia."
